tournament.name: Monday 3rd Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing blink effects to generate value from enter the battlefield triggers of creatures like Agent of Treachery and Fblthp, the Lost. It also includes control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Shatter the Sky and Time Wipe, while generating card advantage with Yorion, Sky Nomad. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game and generate card advantage using Fires of Invention. By casting spells for free with Fires of Invention, the deck can maintain control of the board while developing its own threats. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, the Time Raveler and powerful creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight to pressure opponents and close out games. The deck also includes powerful sweepers like Deafening Clarion to handle opposing creatures and protect its own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to take advantage of the Fires of Invention enchantment to play powerful spells for free. The deck includes various powerful creatures and removal spells to control the board, with a focus on utilizing the mana saved from casting spells with Fires of Invention to play cards like Embercleave and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate. The inclusion of Cavalier of Flame and Cavalier of Thorns provides additional firepower and card advantage, while Kaheera, the Orphanguard offers a unique companion option for added benefits.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset, along with board wipes like Shatter the Sky and Deafening Clarion. It aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage from Narset, Parter of Veils, and utility from Keruga as a companion. The deck also utilizes counterspells like Mystical Dispute to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating tokens with Shark Typhoon. It aims to stabilize the board and grind out the opponent with versatile spells like Inspired Ultimatum and Elspeth Conquers Death.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and card draw to slow down the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Nightpack Ambusher and Wilderness Reclamation, the deck can generate a steady stream of threats and mana advantage to outvalue the opponent in the long run. The deck also includes versatile threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Brazen Borrower to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to maintain board control and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful and relentless aggressive strategy by utilizing the synergy between sacrificing creatures and gaining value from death triggers. With a combination of cards that allow for repeated sacrifices, recursion of creatures from the graveyard, and generating additional benefits from sacrificing creatures, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents quickly with an onslaught of aggressive plays and efficient resource management. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion further enhances the deck's ability to maintain a strong board presence and outpace opponents in the early game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast powerful spells for free. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, creatures with powerful abilities, and card draw options to maintain board control and advance the game plan. By efficiently casting spells without spending mana, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with threats while controlling the battlefield and card advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion adds a card advantage engine to the deck, providing additional resources for the control strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing fires of invention to play powerful spells for free while controlling the board with cards like Cavalier of Flame, Deafening Clarion, and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Narset of the Ancient Way and Keruga, the Macrosage, as well as powerful threats like Kenrith, the Returned King and Sphinx of Foresight. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multiple colors and spell requirements. The deck aims to control the game early on and then overwhelm the opponent with its powerful spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with powerful creatures and spells while utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free. The goal is to establish board control and maintain card advantage while using Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion to draw additional cards. The deck plays versatile threats like Kenrith, the Returned King and Dream Trawler, supplemented by removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Banishing Light. Additionally, the deck aims to stabilize the board with sweepers like Deafening Clarion and Shatter the Sky, ultimately aiming to outvalue and outlast the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free, allowing the player to control the board and tempo of the game. By leveraging powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion, as well as big threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. With a diverse mix of removal, threats, and card advantage, this deck seeks to dominate the mid-to-late game with powerful plays and strategic decision-making.

The main strategy of this deck is to use a combination of sacrifice effects and recursion to control the board while dealing incremental damage to the opponent. By sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Gilded Goose to Witch's Oven and Mayhem Devil triggers, as well as using Fiend Artisan to search for key pieces, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them out of resources. Cards like Massacre Girl and Korvold, Fae-Cursed King provide additional control and card advantage, allowing the deck to dominate the late game.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of low-cost, evasive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards that can counter opponent's spells and protect its own creatures, while also including creatures with flash and abilities that can provide card advantage, the deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain tempo throughout the game. The mono blue color allows for consistency in mana base, ensuring that the deck can consistently execute its aggressive game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to use a combination of sacrifice effects and aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven to repeatedly sacrifice and return creatures, combined with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Claim the Firstborn to control the board and steal the opponent's creatures, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck can also constantly bring back key creatures from the graveyard to maintain its aggressive strategy.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on recurring creatures from the graveyard while applying pressure on the opponent with aggressive early-game plays. The key strategy revolves around sacrificing creatures like Serrated Scorpion and Cauldron Familiar to trigger effects like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Call of the Death-Dweller. Utilizing synergies between cards like Claim the Firstborn and Witch's Oven, this deck aims to maintain board presence, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and deal consistent damage quickly to secure a victory.

The deck revolves around controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and powerful threats. It aims to cast spells at instant speed, efficiently responding to the opponent's plays while generating card advantage. The main win conditions are using powerful creatures like Frilled Mystic, Nightpack Ambusher, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to pressure the opponent, alongside cards like Expansion / Explosion for a big finish. The deck utilizes Wilderness Reclamation to generate mana advantage and out-value the opponent in the late game. Overall, it focuses on controlling the board and tempo to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and utilizing powerful instant and sorcery spells to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck focuses on card advantage and versatility, using cards like Expansion / Explosion and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to gain value and outvalue opponents. The addition of counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Frilled Mystic help to protect your own game plan while disrupting opponents. The deck also has a win condition in Shark Typhoon, creating a large flying threat to close out the game.
